name: Criminal Records History
description: Details of an individual's past criminal activities or convictions. Eg: criminalHistory, crime_bg, crimRecord, userCrimeHistory, criminal_activity_flag.

name: Reference Checks
description: Information related to employment or personal reference verification, e.g., referenceCheckId, ref_verification_status, referenceCheckResult, refcheck_token, verificationcheck_flag.

name: Employment History
description: Details of previous jobs, positions, or work tenure. e.g: emp_history, employmentCheck, employmentVerification, pastEmployment, jobHistory, prevEmp, empHist.

name: Compensation History
description: Records of prior salaries or compensation, e.g., pastSalary, previousCompensation, salaryHistory, latestCTC, or comp_hist, reflecting payment details from past employments.

name: Credit History
description: Details of an individual's past borrowing and repayment, e.g., creditScore, loanHistory, credit_report, financialCondition, loanTaken, creditWorth, creditRank, creditRecord.

name: Address
description: Structured postal or physical address information used for mail delivery and physical location identification. e.g: addrLine1, homeAddr, shippingAddress, billing_addr, deliveryLocation, houseNo.

name: Email Address
description: Personal email address for communication. Examples: email=john@example.com, user_email=jane.doe@company.org, contact_mail=test@gmail.com. Look for @ symbol with valid domain format. Critical: System emails (noreply@, support@, info@, admin@, system@, notifications@) are organizational, not personal data.

name: Phone Number
description: Phone number of an individual. Examples: phone=+1-555-1234567, mobile_no=9876543210, contact=(555)123-4567, user_tel=555.1234. Look for 7-15 digit numbers with optional formatting (+, -, parentheses, spaces). Critical: Exclude toll-free (1-800, 1-888, 1-877), emergency services (911, 112, 999), shortcodes (< 7 digits), and fax numbers.

name: Emergency Contact Details
description: Details of a person to contact in emergencies, e.g., emergencyContactNumber, emergency_contact_email, emergContactMob, emergencyContactRelation, emergency-contact-detail.

name: Total Experience
description: Represents years or duration of work experience. e.g: totalExperience, candidateExperience, applicant_experience, jobApplicantExperience, total_exp, yrsExp, workYears.

name: Past Employers
description: Names or details of previous employers or work history. e.g: pastEmployer, prev_emp, workHistory, employmentExperience, candidatePastCompany, empWorkHistory, previousEmployers.

name: Past Roles or Positions
description: Details of previous job titles or roles held, e.g., pastRole=Manager, prevJobTitle=Engineer, pastPosition=Director, prevRole=Analyst, pastEmpRole=Consultant.

name: Past Salary Details
description: Records of prior earnings, e.g., pastSalary, prev_salary, salaryHistory, salary_hist, previousSalary, salaryHistory2022, prevSal, salaryDetailsPrev.

name: Reason for leaving or change of job
description: Details explaining why a person left or changed a job, e.g., reasonForLeaving, jobChangeReason, employmentChangeReason, leftJobReason, or reason-leaving.

name: Past Dates of Employment
description: Represents start/end dates of previous jobs, e.g., jobStartDate, employmentToDate, emp_end_dt, startEmploymentDate, jobfromdate, pastEmpStart, prev_job_end.

name: Proof of Last Salary
description: Proof of last salary such as salaryslip, lastsalaryslip, prevsalaryslip, latestsalaryslip; used to verify employment income, last_slip, prevSalSlip, or ltsalaryslip.

name: Vehicle Registration Number
description: Unique identifier assigned to a vehicle, e.g., vehicleRegNo, car_registration_num, truckRegNumber, motorcycleRegNbr, tractor_registration_no, often used for tracking or authentication purposes.

name: License Plate
description: Vehicle license plate identifier. e.g: licensePlate, license_plate_num, licPlateNumber, license-plate-no, l_plate_num, vehicle_license_plate, licPlateNbr.

name: Video
description: Represents visual recordings or media, e.g., videoClip, cctvFootage, cameraFeed, webcamRecording, vid_rec, cam_footage, videoStream, cctvClip, camVid, webcamFeed.

name: Audio Recordings
description: Voice or audio content files created by users. Examples: voice_message=audio_123.mp3, voice_recording=blob:abc123, audio_note=base64_encoded_audio. Look for actual audio file references, blob IDs, or encoded audio data. Critical: audio_codec, audio_bitrate, volume_level, audio_quality are technical settings about audio, NOT actual recordings.

name: IoT or Sensor Data
description: Data from user's personal IoT devices or wearables. Examples: fitness_tracker={steps:10000,heartrate:72}, smart_home={temperature:72,lights:on}, wearable_data=health_metrics_123. Look for readings from devices owned/used by specific users. Critical: device_specs, sensor_calibration, device_capabilities are technical properties, NOT user's actual sensor readings.

name: Purchase History
description: Collection of user's past transactions over time. Examples: purchase_history=[{date:2024-01,order:123},{date:2024-02,order:456}], order_history=user_transactions_all, past_purchases=historical_orders. Look for arrays/lists showing multiple past orders. Critical: Single current transaction is Order Details, NOT Purchase History - this is specifically about multiple past transactions.

name: Product Return History
description: Tracks details of returned, cancelled, or exchanged products/orders, e.g. returnHistory, cancelOrder, exchangeProd, retProdHist, cancel_purchase, exchngPrdct.

name: Order Details
description: Information about specific purchase transaction. Examples: order_id=ORD-2024-123456, purchase_details={items:[shirt,pants],total:89.99}, transaction_info=checkout_abc. Look for specific order IDs, purchase items, transaction amounts. Critical: sort_order, display_order, z_order, tab_order control UI element positioning, NOT purchase transactions.

name: Offer Details
description: Details about discounts, offers, coupons, cashback, or rewards applied to a purchase. e.g: specialOfferCode, appliedCoupon, cashbackID, rewardPoints, productDiscount, offerDetail, couponCode.

name: Social Media Account
description: User's profile identifier on social platforms. Examples: facebook_profile=fb.user.123456, twitter_account=@johndoe, instagram_id=user_jane. Look for actual social media profile references or handles. Critical: social_share_button, facebook_widget, twitter_api are platform integrations, NOT user's personal social accounts.

name: Social Media Activity
description: Tracks user actions on social platforms, e.g., fb_likes, insta_comments, twitter_tweet, reddit_upvote, pinterest_pin, yt_shares, sm_activity, social_evt, or user_action

name: Social Media Contact
description: Refers to any handle, ID, or link identifying a user's social profile, e.g. socialAccount, social_id, socialUser, socialProfile, socAccnt, socialUserName, socialProfileUrl.

name: Iris Recognition
description: Unique biometric identifier from iris scan, e.g. irisRecognition, irisScanID, iris_feature_code, irisScanToken, irisRecogHash; used for user authentication or identification.

name: Facial Recognition
description: Biometric facial measurements used for identity verification. Examples: face_embedding=[0.123,0.456,...], facial_biometric_id=face_auth_789, face_vector=biometric_template. Look for facial feature vectors, embeddings, or biometric templates. Critical: Regular photos, selfies, profile_picture, face_filter are images, NOT biometric identification data.

name: Voice Recognition
description: Voice biometric patterns for identity verification. Examples: voice_print=biometric_hash_789, voiceprint_id=voice_auth_123, voice_signature=audio_pattern_456. Look for voice biometric templates or voiceprints used for authentication. Critical: voice_command, speech_to_text, voice_input are interaction methods, NOT biometric identification.

name: Handwriting Recognition
description: Data capturing or processing handwriting for identification or analysis. e.g: handwritingRecognition, handwrittenTextRecognition, handwriting_text_recog, hwr_recog.

name: DNA Matching
description: Represents DNA profile or genetic sequence info, e.g., dnaMatch, dnaSeqResult, proteSeqID, dnaScanID, dna_sequence, proteinsequence, often used for biometric identification or ancestry matching.

name: Gait
description: Describes unique walking patterns or movements, e.g., abnormalGait, strideLength, footAngle, heelStrike, lateralStride, midfootStrike, footProgressionAngle.

name: Video Recordings
description: Captures visual content or screen activity as video, videoRecording, screenRecording, vidRec, or screenRec

name: Website Filtering
description: Tracks access to allowed or blocked websites/domains, e.g., websiteBlocked, domainWhitelisted, blacklistedSite, whitelistedDomain, blockedWebsite, siteBlocked, domainBlacklisted, whitelisted_site.

name: Building Information System Access
description: Tracks entry/exit or access events to workplace buildings, e.g., accessCardNum, empCheckIn, punchCardTime, badgeID, accessEntry, empCheckOut, acsCrd, punchIn, acsEntry, badgeIn, cardNo.

name: Application Usage
description: User's app interaction patterns and time spent. Examples: app_usage_time=3h45m, feature_usage=[login:5,search:12,purchase:2], daily_active_time=125min. Look for time spent, feature interactions, or usage frequency tied to specific user. Critical: app_version, app_build, app_config are application metadata, NOT user's usage patterns.

name: Parents Name
description: Parent or guardian's name, e.g., guardianName, mother_name, fatherName, nameOfFather, name-mother, mthr_name. Identifies a user's familial or dependent relationship.

name: Parents Contact Details
description: Parent or guardian's contact info such as phone, mobile, or email. Eg: father_contact, motherPhoneNbr, guardianEmail, father_mobile, mother_addr, guardianLandline.

name: Spouse Name
description: Name of an individual's spouse or partner. e.g: spouseName, wife_name, husbandNm, fianceName, spousename1, partnerName, spouseFullName.

name: Spouse Contact Details
description: Spouses contact info such as phone, mobile, or email. e.g: spouse_phone, wifeEmail, husbandMob, fianceContact, spouse_addr, spouseMobileNbr, wifeContactNumber.

name: Dependent Name
description: Name of a family member or dependent, e.g., dependentName, daughter_name, spouseName, childFullName, wifeName, grandfatherName, dependant.

name: Dependent Contact Details
description: Contact info for spouse or dependents, e.g., dependent_phone, familyEmail, daughter_mobile, wife_address, childrenNbr, grandparentContact, fiance_email, or dependentAddr.

name: Bank Account Details
description: Actual financial account numbers used for banking. Examples: account_number=1234567890123456, iban=DE89370400440532013000, routing_and_account=123456789-987654321. Look for 8-20 digit account numbers, IBAN format, or masked accounts (****1234). Critical: Bank name alone (Chase, Wells Fargo) is just the institution - need actual account numbers to be personal data.

name: Card Issuer
description: Identifies the bank or company issuing a card, e.g., cardIssuer=Chase, creditCardIssuer=HSBC, debitCardIssuer=AMEX, issuer=Visa, card_issuer=BOA.

name: Card Number
description: Card Number identifies payment cards, e.g., creditCardNumber, debit_card_no, cc_num, cardnbr, cc-number, or creditcard

name: VPA Address
description: Virtual Payment Address (VPA) identifies a user's UPI account; appears as upi_id, vpa, virtualpaymentaddress, payee_vpa, merchant-vpa, or payment_vpa

name: Payment Nonce
description: Unique, single-use token for processing payments, e.g., paymentNonce, pay_nonce, payments-nonce, paytoken, used to authorize financial transactions without storing card details.

name: Payment Mode
description: Payment method chosen by user for transaction. Examples: payment_method=credit_card, pay_type=paypal, selected_payment=apple_pay. Look for user's actual payment choice in specific transaction. Critical: available_payment_methods, supported_payments list system capabilities, NOT user's actual choice.

name: Credit Score
description: Numeric value representing a person's creditworthiness, e.g., creditScore, cibil_score, ficoScore, schufaScore, crisilScore, credit_score_val, custCreditScore, userFicoScore.

name: Tax Information
description: Details about tax rates, amounts, types, or numbers. E.g., taxRate, tax_amount, taxableValue, taxInfo, incomeTax, taxNumber, form1099, tax_detail, taxSlip, taxPercent.

name: Retirement Account Information
description: Details about retirement savings or pension accounts, e.g., 401kPlan, retirementAcct, pensionAccountID, 401k_number, retire_plan_id, pension_acct, or retAcctNo.

name: Payroll Information
description: Details about employee salary, wages, deductions, or payroll cycles. Example: payroll_id, pay_roll_amt, payrollDate, payrollStatus, pay-roll-cycle.

name: Expenses
description: Represents costs incurred, e.g., travelExpense, businessReimbursement, lodgingExpense, foodReimbursement, healthcareExpense, mileageExpense, medicalReimbursement, expenseType=lodging.

name: Company Allowances
description: Represents monetary benefits provided by an employer, such as dearness, house rent, medical, travel, overtime, or entertainment allowance. E.g., dearnessAllowance, hraAllowance, medical_allowance.

name: Stock or Equity Grants
description: Represents employee or user stock/equity grants, options, or awards. e.g: incentiveStockOption, empStockGrant, rsuUnits, esppPlan, phantomStock, commonStockGrant, stockAppreciationRights.

name: Salary
description: Monetary compensation paid to an employee. Variations: salary_amt, empSalary, basicSalary, salarySlip, payDetail, currEmployeeSalary, hraAllowance, daAllowance, prevEmpPay.

name: Benefits
description: Describes employee financial perks such as gymMembership, freeLunch, empDiscount, bonus, insurancePlan, pensionPlan, flexibleHours, companyCar, or relocationBonus. E.g. perfBonus, visionIns, empAssist.

name: Insurance Number
description: Unique identifier for an insurance policy or claim, e.g. insuranceNumber, policy_id, ni-no, cardInsurance, insuranceClaimNbr, insurancePlanID, insurancenumber.

name: Marital Status
description: Indicates if user is single, married, divorced, seperated, etc. e.g: marital_status, marriedStatus, relationshipStatus, userMarital, maritalStat

name: Nationality
description: Indicates a person's country of origin; e.g: nationality=US, user_nationality=Indian, nat=FR, or nationalities=CA.

name: Racial or Ethnic Origin
description: Indicates a person's race or ethnicity, e.g., ethnicity=asian, user_racial_group=latino, ethnicOrigin=black, racialType=indian, ethnicityCode=wh.

name: Religion / Religious Beliefs
description: Indicates a person's religion or beliefs, e.g., religion:Christian, religiousBelief=Hindu, religionGroup:Muslim, user_religion=Jewish, religiousAffil:Buddhist.

name: Sexual Orientation
description: Indicates a person's sexual preferences or orientation. e.g: sexualOrientation, sexual_pref, sexual-nature, sexualInclination, sexPref, usrSexualOrientation, soIncl.

name: Signature
description: Represents a user's handwritten or digital signature (e.g., userSignature, buyer_signature, personSign), used to verify identity or authorize actions. Variants: customerSign, publisherSignature.

name: Weight
description: Body weight or mass of a person. Examples: weight=75kg, user_weight=165lbs, bmi=22.5, patient_weight=70. Look for numeric values with weight units (kg/lbs/pounds) in health or profile contexts. Critical: u_w is viewport width (NOT body weight), also exclude product_weight, shipping_weight, or package dimensions.

name: Ratings
description: User-provided score or feedback value, e.g., userRating, product_rating, avgRating, movieRatings, hotelRating, doctorRating, ratingValue, seller_ratings, or customerRating.

name: Reviews
description: User-submitted comments, feedback, or ratings about products or services. Eg: userReview, movieReviews, buyerReview, doctorreview, hotelReview, sellerReviews, agentreview.

name: Emails or Text Messages
description: Contains content of user emails or text messages, e.g. emailMessage, emailContent, emailMsg, emailText, email_message, emailMsgBody, emailTextContent, or similar variations.

name: Customer Support
description: Support tickets or help requests submitted by specific users. Examples: ticket_id=HELP-123456, support_case=USR789-ISSUE, complaint_number=2024-CMP-001. Look for ticket IDs or case numbers created when users request help. Critical: support_docs, FAQ_pages, help_articles are general resources, NOT user-specific support requests.

name: NPS or CSAT Scores
description: Numeric or text values reflecting user satisfaction, e.g. NPS=9, csat_score=5, netPromoter=10, customerSatisfaction=high, feedback_result=positive, surveyResponse=7, prod_feedback=good.

name: Crash Data
description: Crash Data includes logs or reports on system/app failures. e.g: crashReport, crashLog, crashStatus, crashDump, crashFile, crashTable, crshRpt, crshLog, crash_report, crash-dump.

name: Browsing History
description: Individual user's sequence of visited pages over time. Examples: user_browsing=[/home,/products,/checkout], page_history=usr123_navigation, clickpath_sequence=session_abc_pages. Look for page sequences tied to specific user ID or session. Critical: Aggregated analytics like "1000 users visited this page" is NOT individual browsing history - must be tied to specific user.

name: Technical Diagnostic Data
description: Contains system performance or diagnostic info, e.g., performancelog, cpuUsage, memory_used, diskAvailable, perfReport, cpu_freq. Used for monitoring, troubleshooting, or health checks.

name: Browsing Time
description: Timestamp or duration capturing user's site activity, e.g., browsingTime, browsing_duration, brwsngTimeMs, bTime, bDur, browsingTimeSpent.

name: Disability or Specific Condition
description: Indicates a specific health condition or disability, e.g. autism_status, is_diabetic, mentalIllness, cancerType, wheelchairUser, hearingImpairment, disability_status.

name: Illness or Medical Condition
description: Describes user's illness or medical condition, e.g., medicalCondition=asthma, illnessType=flu, userHealth=diabetes, employeeMedical=hypertension, healthRecord=anemia.

name: Maternity Leave Details
description: Information about an individual's maternity leave status or duration, e.g., maternityLeave, maternity_leave_days, matLeaveStatus, maternityLeaveStart, maternity_leave_end.

name: Paternity Leave Details
description: Information about employee's paternity leave, such as start/end dates or status. e.g: paternityLeave, pat_leave_start, paternity-leave-duration, patLeaveStatus, pat-leave-request.

name: Medical Certificates
description: Medical Certificates: Documents or info confirming medical status, e.g., medicalCertificate, medCert, bloodReport, medical_report, bloodGroup, medicalTest in fields or param names.

name: Date of Birth
description: Represents an individual's birth date. e.g: dob, dateofbirth, birthdate, bday, birth_dt, birth-year, birth_month, birthDay, bdate, birthdate=1990-01-01

name: First Name
description: First name or given name identifying an individual. e.g: fname, first_name, givenName, forename, full_name=John, userFName, fname=Jane, customerFirstName.

name: Gender
description: Gender or biological sex of a person. Examples: gender=male, user_sex=F, is_female=true, customer_gender=M. Look for values like M/F, Male/Female, 0/1 in user profiles. Critical: 'sex' parameter alone often refers to content categories (e.g., 'Sex & Relationships' pages) - requires user profile context to be personal data.

name: Last Name
description: Surname or family name of a person, lastname, lname, last_name, l_name, surName, userLastName, or cust_lname.

name: Age
description: Age of a person in years. Examples: user_age=25, customer_age=30, age_years=45. Look for numeric values 0-150 in user profile contexts. Critical: Plain 'age' parameter often means cache_age, content_age, or page_age - requires clear user/demographic context like surrounded by name, email, or other personal fields.

name: Employee Code
description: Individual employee's unique identifier within organization. Examples: employee_id=EMP123456, staff_code=STAFF-789, worker_number=WRK001. Look for IDs assigned to individual employees. Critical: department_code, team_id, role_id identify organizational units, NOT individual employees.

name: Photograph
description: Photograph used for personal ID, e.g., profilePicture, user_image, employeePic, profile-photo, userpic, profileImg. May appear as img URLs or base64-encoded image data.

name: Precise Location
description: High-accuracy geolocation data representing the user or device's exact position, typically obtained via GPS, WiFi triangulation, or similar sensors. Values are latitude and longitude coordinates with MORE than two decimal places (e.g., 37.774929, -122.419416). Example fields: gpsLocation, geoCoordinates, latitude, longitude, latlng, latlon, lat, lon (only when precision exceeds two decimal places).

name: Device Identifier
description: Unique identifier linked to a user's device; e.g: mobile info, desktop info, deviceId, device-info, deviceToken, deviceDetails, imei, x-deviceid, dev_id, deviceinfo, android id, ios id etc

name: IP Address
description: Network address identifying user's device. Examples: ip_address=203.0.113.0, user_ip=192.0.2.1, client_ip=2001:db8::1. Look for IPv4 or IPv6 addresses in user tracking contexts. Critical: Localhost (127.0.0.1), private networks (10.x, 192.168.x, 172.16-31.x) and server_ip are infrastructure, not user data.

name: MAC Address
description: Unique hardware identifier for network devices. e.g: mac, mac_address, client_mac, ieee_address, macid, device_mac, ipmac, macAddr. Used to track device connectivity.

name: Pixel
description: A small code snippet or identifier used to track online activity, e.g., fbp, ga_pixel, trk_pixel, adpixel, pixel_id, tracking_pixel.

name: Advertising Identifiers
description: Mobile advertising IDs for ad personalization. Examples: idfa=EA7583CD-A667-48BC-B806-42ECB2B48606, gaid=38400000-8cf0-11bd-b23e-10b96e40000d, advertising_id=12345678-1234-1234. Look for IDFA (iOS) or GAID/AAID (Android) in UUID format. Critical: campaign_id, ad_group_id, creative_id are marketing campaign identifiers, NOT device advertising IDs.

name: Educational History
description: Details of academic background such as degrees earned or institutions attended. e.g: bachelorDegree, schoolAttended, edu_history, universityAttended, mastersDegree.

name: Skills
description: Describes user's abilities or proficiencies, e.g., programmingSkills=Python, softSkills=communication, technicalSkills=Java, speakingSkills=French, skills=Excel;leadership.

name: Academic Transcripts
description: Academic transcripts detail courses, grades, and degrees earned. Seen as academicTranscript, bachelorDegreeCert, mastersCert, diplomaCopy, or pgCertificate.

name: Account ID
description: Unique identifier for a user account. Examples: account_id=USR123456, user_id=12345, customer_no=CUST-789. Look for alphanumeric IDs assigned to user accounts in systems. Critical: Exclude session_id, request_id, transaction_id (temporary identifiers), and system/service account IDs.

name: Social Media Login Identifier
description: Social platform ID used for authentication. Examples: google_oauth_id=1234567890, facebook_login_id=fb_auth_456, twitter_sso_id=tw_user_789. Look for OAuth/SSO identifiers from social platforms. Critical: social_login_button, oauth_config, sso_settings are authentication setup, NOT user's actual social login ID.

name: Language Preferences
description: Indicates user's language choice, e.g., lang=en, user_language=fr, preferredLanguage=es. Used to personalize content or UI based on selected language.

name: Account Password
description: User's secret authentication credential. Examples: password=***, user_pwd=encrypted, login_psw=hashed_value. Look for password fields in login/registration forms. Critical: Exclude api_key, db_password, aws_secret (system credentials), and password requirements/policies.

name: Mnemonic
description: Mnemonic phrase or code used for account recovery or authentication. e.g: mnemonic, mnemonic_phrase, userMnemonic, mnemonicKey, mnemo

name: Account Name
description: User's account name or username. Examples: username=johndoe, account_name=jane_smith, user_name=michael123. Look for human-readable account identifiers in login/profile contexts. Critical: Exclude service_account, system_user, db_user (technical accounts).

name: Click Stream
description: Records user interactions like clicks, taps, or navigation; e.g., clickStream, clickTrack, trackClick, numberOfClicks, click_count, trackInteractions, trackFrustrations.

name: Search History
description: Records of user search queries, e.g., searchHistory, savedSearch1, pastSearch, srch_hist, or prev_searches, capturing terms or phrases entered by users.

name: Product Interactions
description: Tracks user actions with products, such as buttons_clicked, pagesViewed, event_streamingData, event-monitoring, eventTracking, or productInteractionData.

name: Passport
description: Passport number or details used for identification, e.g., passportNo, passNo, passport_id, passportNumber, passportExpiry, passportCountry, pass_num, pport_no, pport_expiry.

name: Driving License
description: Driving License number or ID, often appears as driving_license_no, driverLicNum, dl_number, or drvLicID; may be formatted as plain text, with dashes, or as part of user profile data.

name: Social Security Number
description: US government-issued 9-digit taxpayer identification number. Examples: ssn=123-45-6789, social_security_number=123456789, user_ssn=XXX-XX-6789. Look for exactly 9 numeric digits in formats XXX-XX-XXXX or XXXXXXXXX in identity, tax, or employment contexts. Critical: Must be NUMERIC ONLY (no letters), exactly 9 digits, in SSN format. Exclude: technical IDs containing 'ssn' substring (uid-ssn, key_ssn), alphanumeric values, session IDs, or any non-numeric identifiers even if parameter contains 'ssn'.

name: Taxpayer Identification Number
description: Unique national ID for tax purposes, e.g., TIN, TaxPayerID, TaxIDNo, ITIN, PTIN, tax_id, tin_no, taxpayer_number, or itin

name: Employer Identification Number
description: unique identifier assigned to businesses for tax purposes. e.g: EIN, employer_id, employerIdentificationNo, employer-id, ein_number, employerID, employerIdentNo

name: Personal Public Service Number
description: Personal Public Service Number (PPSN), unique Irish ID, often appears as personalpublicserviceno, pps_no, pps-number, or ppsno.

name: User Agent
description: String identifying browser, device, OS, or app version, e.g., Mozilla/5.0, UA, user_agent, userAgent, user-agent, ua_str.

name: Fingerprint Scans
description: Unique biometric identifier from a user's fingerprint, fp_hash, finger_id, fprint, or biometric_fp.

name: Height
description: Physical height of a person. Examples: height=175cm, user_height=5'9", person_ht=1.75m, height_in_inches=70. Look for numeric values with units (cm/m/ft/in) in user profile or health contexts. Critical: u_h and u_w are viewport dimensions (NOT personal measurements), also exclude pixel heights (786px), container_height, or element dimensions.

name: User Location
description: Personal location information that identifies where a customer or user lives, receives deliveries, or personally resides. This includes user addresses, home locations, and personal geographic identifiers such as postal code, address, pincode, region, district, city, state, country, postal codes when associated with customer/user/account/billing/shipping/delivery context. This does NOT include business locations (store, restaurant, merchant, branch), system configuration (app country, language settings), or generic parameters (storeNumber, variables)

name: Coarse Geo Coordinates
description: Approximate geolocation data with intentionally reduced precision to avoid exact tracking. Values are latitude and longitude coordinates with UP TO two decimal places (e.g., 37.77, -122.41). This includes truncated or rounded coordinates and center points of regions. Example fields: lat, lon (only when precision is two decimal places or less), truncatedLat, truncatedLong, regionLat, regionLong.

name: User Consent Data
description: User's actual consent choices for data processing. Examples: gdpr_consent=accepted, cookie_consent=true, marketing_optin=false, privacy_accepted=2024-01-15. Look for boolean/date values showing user's consent status. Critical: consent_form_template, privacy_policy_text, terms_of_service are documents/forms, NOT user's actual consent status.

name: Unique User Identifier
description: Persistent ID tracking same user across sessions. Examples: user_uuid=550e8400-e29b-41d4, visitor_id=persistent_usr_123, tracking_id=cross_session_456. Look for IDs that remain constant for user across multiple visits. Critical: session_id, request_id, transaction_id are temporary for single session/request, NOT persistent user tracking.

name: User Video Viewing Data
description: User's video watching behavior and history. Examples: watched_videos=[video123,video456], viewing_time=45min, last_watched_position=12:34, video_progress=75%. Look for watch history, viewing duration, or engagement metrics tied to specific user. Critical: video_codec, video_resolution, player_settings are technical properties, NOT user's viewing behavior.
